titleStmt.title: A Transcription of the Yasna in Y_Y_29_9_11

availability.p: Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) Available for re-use under a creative commons license provided attribution is made to the original creators

projectDesc.p: This transcription was made by the Multimedia Yasna Project.

editorialDecl.p: This transcription was made using the MUYA OTE.

ab.note: The absence of the separating dot at the end of the line does not necessarily indicate that the last word word on the line and its following one on the next line are considered as univerbated in the manuscript. It is confirmed by the marginal catchword (.ax) occuring at the page bottom of fol 37. The reason is that while there is no dot between dātaiia (37v17) and axšaiiamnǝm (38r1), the catchword places a dot befor ax. Therefore, in the transcription, complete words occuring at the end of the line without a separating dot are takes as single unit.
The compositional dot is composed of three vertical dots.
A red colour occurs on uu written in black ink.
